Transcription: C.T.62 Local Tribunal Lampeter Borough No. 11399 CENTRAL TRIBUNAL, QUEEN ANNE'S CHAMBERS, TOTHILL STREET, WESTMINSTER, S.W., 30 March, 1916 SUBJECT: Application to be treated as starred made on behalf of Thomas Davies Evans Sir, With reference to this application, I am desired by the Central Tribunal to inform you that the occupation entered on the form was not one of those included in the list of starred occupations and, therefore, the man is not entitled to be treated as starred. As the application appears to have been made under a misapprehension, if the man is voluntarily attested and exemption from being called up for service is desired, fresh application may be made, provided that it is made to the Local Tribunal within five days of the date of this letter. A form of application is enclosed. The grounds on which an application may be made are indicated on the form. As is pointed out in the form of application (see (e) in the footnote on the form) a list of the certified occupations may be seen at the office of the Local Tribunal or of the Recruiting Officer. A man who has been attested and has not been granted exemption, or in respect of whom an application for exemption is not pending, is liable to be called up for service with the Colours. An application for exemption should not, of course, be made unless there are good grounds for it. This letter should be attached to the form if fresh application is made. Transcription: I am 39 years of age, grade 2, and married with two children. I am now full up with orders and have not taken any new orders for three months. I have enough to keep me fully employed up to next May. A few months before the war broke out I expended a lot of money on new buildings, plant and machinery. A great deal of my money is sunk in these, and I have not had an opportunity of getting it back. My liabilities at present amount to about £225 , and I have to pay in rent rates and taxes about £20 a year. I hold a lease of the premises with six years to run and have about £100 worth of raw materials on my hand now. I have no one to carry on the business in my absence, as I have to manufacture all the goods I sell. I would therefore have to close down.
